title:
Comments on: RIO: Return Instruction Obfuscation for Bare-Metal IoT
  Devices with Binary Analysis
abstract:
This is a comment on "RIO: Return Instruction Obfuscation for Bare-Metal IoT
Devices with Binary Analysis". RIO prevents finding gadgets for Return-Oriented
Programming attacks by encrypting return instructions. This paper shows flaws
in the design of RIO that allow for the easy retrieval of the plaintext return
instructions without decrypting them. Additionally, changes are proposed to
improve upon the original idea.
